Package Main.Models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Main.Models.Player
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
Public class Player creates a rectangle shape with which the player controls to bounce the ball towards the bricks. The player with the given midpoint and dimensions are created. All the setters and getters required are also here.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian, Filippo Ranza

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(java.awt.Point midPoint, int width, int height, java.awt.Dimension area)
      This constructor is used to create a player with the given midpoint and dimensions. The min and max position of the player is also defined here using the dimensions of the screen.
      Parameters:
      midPoint - The midpoint of the new player.
      width - The width of the new player.
      height - The height of the new player.
      area - The dimensions of the screen to define the min and max position of the player.

  • Method Details

    • getMidPoint

      public java.awt.Point getMidPoint()
      This method is used to return the midpoint of the player. It is used to check for the current position of the player so that the player can be drawn.
      Returns:
      The midpoint of the player is returned.

    • setMidPoint

      public void setMidPoint​(java.awt.Point midPoint)
      This method is used to set the new midpoint of the player to move the player.
      Parameters:
      midPoint - This is the new midpoint of the player.

    • getMoveAmount

      public int getMoveAmount()
      This method is used to return the move amount of the player. It is the amount that the player moves in the next update cycle.
      Returns:
      The move amount of the player is returned.

    • setMoveAmount

      public void setMoveAmount​(int moveAmount)
      This method is change the move amount of the player. It is the amount that the player moves in the next update cycle.
      Parameters:
      moveAmount - This is the amount the player moves in the next update cycle.

    • getMin

      public int getMin()
      This method is used to return the min position of the player on the screen.
      Returns:
      The min position of the player is returned.

    • getMax

      public int getMax()
      This method is used to return the max position of the player on the screen.
      Returns:
      The max position of the player is returned.

    • getPlayerFace

      public java.awt.Rectangle getPlayerFace()
      This method is used to return the player face.
      Returns:
      The player face is returned.

    • setPlayerFace

      public void setPlayerFace​(java.awt.Rectangle playerFace)
      This method is used to change the player face. It is used to move the player to a new location to simulate movement.
      Parameters:
      playerFace - This is the new player face of the player.

    • getBorder

      public java.awt.Color getBorder()
      This method is used to return the border colour of the player.
      Returns:
      The border colour of the player is returned.

    • getInner

      public java.awt.Color getInner()
      This method is used to return the inner colour of the player.
      Returns:
      The inner colour of the player is returned.

    • getTop

      public int getTop()
      This method is used to return the top max position of the player on the screen.
      Returns:
      The top max position of the player is returned.

    • getBottom

      public int getBottom()
      This method is used to return the bottom min position of the player on the screen.
      Returns:
      The bottom min position of the player is returned.

    • getVerticalMoveAmount

      public int getVerticalMoveAmount()
      This method is used to return the vertical move amount of the player. It is the amount that the player moves in the next update cycle.
      Returns:
      The vertical move amount of the player is returned.

    • setVerticalMoveAmount

      public void setVerticalMoveAmount​(int verticalMoveAmount)
      This method is change the vertical move amount of the player. It is the amount that the player moves in the next update cycle.
      Parameters:
      verticalMoveAmount - This is the amount the player moves vertically in the next update cycle.
